question.title: Will Mexico eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?

The declaration must be validated by official RBI sources, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee reports, or public addresses by RBI representatives. If no such declaration is issued by the resolution date, the inquiry concludes with a NO. It is important to note that the actual date of implementing the rate reduction can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the declaration itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the repo rate, which is the RBI's main instrument for monetary policy.

The interest rate in question pertains to the repo rate, which is the principal tool used by the RBI for monetary policy.

question.title: Will Elon Musk face new bankruptcy proceedings by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, new bankruptcy proceedings are initiated against Elon Musk, as confirmed by official court records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The proceedings must be separate from and unrelated to any previous bankruptcy cases. If no such new proceedings are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, 'new bankruptcy proceedings' refer to any formal legal action filed in a bankruptcy court that names Elon Musk as the debtor, whether it's a voluntary filing by Musk himself or an involuntary petition filed by creditors.

This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Arizona officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Arizona state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will the U.S. Senate pass a bill to cut the FDA's budget by more than 20% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the budget of the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If no such bill is passed by the Senate by the resolution date, or if a bill is passed but the budget cut is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions of budget cuts do not count; the bill must be officially passed by the Senate.

If the Senate does not pass such a legislation by the specified date, or if it does pass a legislation but the budget reduction is 20% or less, the outcome will be FALSE. It is important to note that simply proposing or discussing budget reductions is insufficient; the legislation must be officially enacted by the Senate.

question.title: Will the Nebraska Senate pass a total abortion ban by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Nebraska Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. For the purpose of this question, a 'total abortion ban' refers to legislation that prohibits all or nearly all abortions, with possible exceptions only for cases involving rape, incest, or threat to the mother's life. The passage of such legislation must be confirmed through official Nebraska legislative records. If no such legislation is passed by the specified date, or if only partial restrictions are enacted, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only concerns the passage of the bill in the Senate, not its final enactment into law.

question.title: Will the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official Gates Foundation channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will NASA's Orion capsule complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion capsule successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. The mission must involve the Orion capsule transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The capsule must land safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success must be officially confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- No such mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria.
- The Orion capsule is used only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

question.title: Will Maple Leaf Foods issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:

1. An official announcement on Maple Leaf Foods' website or social media channels

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Microsoft's AI chatbot is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. question.title: Will South Africa's National Council of Provinces pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Ramaphosa by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, South Africa's National Council of Provinces passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Cyril Ramaphosa or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the National Council of Provinces, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Ramaphosa or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the South African economy.

If no such bill is passed by the National Council of Provinces by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

question.title: Will Russia report a bumper harvest for both wheat and sunflowers by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia officially reports a bumper harvest for both wheat and sunflowers, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or TASS). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either wheat or sunflowers) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Marta Rovira return to Spain and face a trial related to the 2017 Catalan independence referendum by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Marta Rovira returns to Spain and is officially put on trial for her involvement in organizing the 2017 Catalan independence referendum. The trial must be formally initiated in a Spanish court, with Rovira physically present or represented by legal counsel. For the purpose of this question, 'trial' refers to the commencement of legal proceedings in a court of law, not merely an indictment or charges being filed. question.title: Will the Bahraini health ministry confirm more than one case of polio in Manama by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Bahraini health ministry officially confirms more than one case of polio in Manama. For the purpose of this question:

1. Confirmation must come from official Bahraini health ministry reports or statements.
2. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
3. The cases must be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023.
4. Only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered.
5. The type of polio (wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) does not matter for this question.

If no additional cases beyond the first are confirmed by the specified date, or if only one case in total is confirmed, the question will resolve as NO.

The ranking must be verified by at least two credible sources like Box Office Mojo, Variety, or The Hollywood Reporter. If another R-rated film overtakes its earnings by this date, or if 'Dredd 2' loses its leading position at any time before the conclusion date, the answer is NO. For this query, only earnings from theatrical releases are counted, excluding any revenues from streaming or video on demand.

question.title: Will Italy's FTSE MIB index reach or exceed 28,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Italy's FTSE MIB index reaches or exceeds 28,000 points. The 28,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Borsa Italiana. If the index does not reach 28,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 28,000 points.

question.title: Will Indonesia officially declare an end to its current dengue outbreak by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Indonesian government or its official health authorities make a formal declaration that the dengue outbreak in Indonesia has ended. The declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, AP, BBC, or Al Jazeera) or by the World Health Organization (WHO). The declaration should specifically state that the dengue outbreak that began in 2023 has been contained or ended. If no such official declaration is made and reported by the specified date, or if the outbreak is still ongoing, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Meng Wanzhou be extradited to the United States by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Meng Wanzhou is legally transferred from Canada to the United States to face legal proceedings. If Meng remains in Canada without being extradited by the resolution date, or if she is released from custody entirely, the question resolves as NO. question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Larry Page on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Larry Page must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Apple's Siri be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Apple's Siri is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Siri and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Los Angeles announce a public transit-only policy for 2028 Olympic venues by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Mayor of Los Angeles or an official representative of the city government announces a policy stating that all venues for the 2028 Summer Olympics will be accessible only by public transportation. The announcement must be made through official channels (such as a press conference, official statement, or city government website) or reported by at least two major news outlets. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announced policy allows for any significant exceptions to the public transit-only rule, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Xiaomi distribute smartphones to North Korean athletes at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Xiaomi officially distributes its smartphones to North Korean athletes participating in the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris. For a YES resolution, all of the following conditions must be met:

1. Xiaomi must proceed with the distribution despite any potential concerns about U.N. Security Council sanctions.
2. The distribution must be confirmed by official statements from Xiaomi, the International Olympic Committee (IOC), or relevant Olympic authorities.
3. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).

The question resolves as NO if any of the following occur:
1. Xiaomi officially announces that it will not distribute smartphones to North Korean athletes.
2. The distribution is officially halted or canceled before completion.
3. By August 31, 2024, there is no clear confirmation that the distribution to North Korean athletes has taken place.

Note: This question does not consider the legality or potential consequences of such a distribution, only whether it occurs.

Note: This question does not consider the legality or possible consequences of such a supply, only whether it occurs.

para_P.title: Will Xiaomi provide smartphones to athletes from North Korea during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
A YES response will be given if, by August 31, 2024, Xiaomi officially delivers its smartphones to North Korean athletes at the 2024 Olympic Games in Paris. For a YES determination, all of the following criteria must be satisfied:

1. Xiaomi must proceed with the delivery regardless of any potential issues related to U.N. Security Council sanctions.
2. The delivery must be verified through official announcements from Xiaomi, the International Olympic Committee (IOC), or relevant Olympic governing bodies.
3. This verification must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).

A NO answer will be given if any of the following occurs:
1. Xiaomi publicly announces that it will not supply smartphones to North Korean athletes.
2. The delivery is officially stopped or canceled before it is completed.
3. By August 31, 2024, there is no definitive confirmation that the smartphones have been supplied to North Korean athletes.

Note: This inquiry does not address the legality or potential ramifications of such a supply, only whether it takes place.

question.title: Will the United Auto Workers endorse Joe Biden for president by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Auto Workers (UAW) officially endorses Joe Biden for the presidential election. The endorsement must be confirmed through official UAW statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). If no endorsement is made by the resolution date, or if the UAW endorses a different candidate, the question resolves as NO.
